intro: Glochidion obscurum var. macrocalyx, commonly known as the large-flowered glochidion, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, including parts of Indonesia and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its smooth, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often found in lowland forests and secondary growth areas. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds, aiding in its dispersal.
